newsitem.title: CHINA: China crude output 80.8215 mln T in first half.
newsitem.headline: China crude output 80.8215 mln T in first half.

text.p: China's total output of crude oil in the first half reached 80.8215 million tonnes, up by 3.2 percent compared with the year-ago period, the State Statistical Bureau said on Tuesday.
It gave no breakdown for onshore and offshore output.
The China National Petroleum Corp said earlier this month that onshore crude oil production totalled 71.07 million tonnes in the first half of the year.

China's oilfields in the South China Sea produced 6.78 million tonnes of crude in the first half, a 31 percent rise over the same period of 1996, state media said earlier. They gave no figure for the rest of offshore output.
Most of China's oil is produced onshore but Beijing is looking to expand offshore output to meet its growing demand for energy.
